item.title: Need help on recyerments
item.dc:creator: @barkingdogc barkingdogc
item.description:
@barkingdogc wrote:

hey i put if (ItemID == 10704) { return 99; } if (ItemID == 10705) { return 120; }
in

public int GetCLAttack(int ItemID)

and i can steal wear at level 1 attack…
i got the give the item at the level but i still need help with above[br][size=1]Posted on: November 14, 2007, 03:49:51 PM[/size][hr]ok i put it in like this

if (wearID == 10704 && (playerLevel[0] <= 98)) { GoFalse = true; sendMessage("You need 99 Attack to wear this cape."); } if (wearID == 10705 && (playerLevel[0] <= 119)) { GoFalse = true; sendMessage("You need 120 Attack to wear this cape."); } if (wearID == 10710 && (playerLevel[1] <= 98)) { GoFalse = true; sendMessage("You need 99 Defence to wear this cape."); } if (wearID == 10711 && (playerLevel[1] <= 119)) { GoFalse = true; sendMessage("You need 120 Defence to wear this cape."); } if (wearID == 10724 && (playerLevel[20] <= 98)) { GoFalse = true; sendMessage("You need 99 Rune Crafting to wear this hood."); } when i put on an attack cape at level 1 it says i need 99 attack and still puts on the cape how do i make it so it doest and i try disconecting but it still puts it back on when they log back in

item.title: Need help on recyerments
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Well you don’t need an object to do that lol. In the levelup method, put it to add the skillscape once they’ve reached 99 of that skill. Incase someone has it, without having the required 99 lvl or 120 lvl, make a method:

I think i’m doing this correct…

if(playerEquipment[playerCape] == SKILLSCAPEID && playerLevel[4]) {
removeItem(playerCape

some shit like i’m not familiar with those methods.

Sry i wrote the top method wrong anyways sorry i have to go, sorry i couldn’t be much of a help but here! this will solve your problem…

http://www.google/showthread.php?t=30419&highlight=Skill+capes

http://www.google/showthread.php?t=31057&highlight=Skill+capes

http://www.google/showthread.php?t=32543&highlight=Skill+capes

http://www.google/showthread.php?t=34129&highlight=Skill+capes

idk why it says google, replace with
rune
server
.
o
r
g

Fucking moparscape blocking my freedom of speech.

item.title: Need help on recyerments
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

what the hell is weild = true; ?

Try it my way, the first way.

Here:

playerLevel[0] = Attack playerLevel[1] = Defence playerLevel[2] = Strength playerLevel[3] = Hitpoints playerLevel[4] = Range playerLevel[5] = Prayer playerLevel[6] = Magic playerLevel[7] = Cooking playerLevel[8] = WoodCutting playerLevel[9] = Fletching playerLevel[10] = Fishing playerLevel[11] = Firemaking playerLevel[12] = Crafting playerLevel[13] = Smithing playerLevel[14] = Mining playerLevel[15] = Herblore playerLevel[16] = Agility playerLevel[17] = Thieving playerLevel[18] = Slayer playerLevel[19] = Farming playerLevel[20] = Runecrafting

EDIT:
ahh i get you now, yes you would add "weild = true; " if thats how its setup on your server.

Read full topic

ok but i need to make that so it doesnt wield…[/quote]

Lol umm easier way?

if(objectID == 1000 && playerLevel[4] >= 99) {
w/e

} else {
sendMessage(“you need 99 range or whatever”);
}

?

If you don’t want to use it that way.

then:

playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == -1 // I guess that would work?
